channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: BrisAsia 2025
item.description:
Wednesday, 5 February – Sunday, 9 February 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support BrisAsia 2025

BrisAsia Festival returns from Friday 31 January to Sunday 9 February 2025 to celebrate Lunar New Year and the transformative energy of the Year of the Snake. Symbolising wisdom, rebirth and new beginnings, this festival will ignite your imagination with an extraordinary fusion of tradition and modern creativity.
Brisbane will come to life with more than 25 activities and events over 10 spectacular days filled with unmissable street performances, awe-inspiring contemporary art, K-Pop showcases, street cars, live music and dazzling displays of traditional and contemporary dance.

This Light Up is organsied by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organsied by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: 2025 Oceania Track Championships
item.description:
Tuesday, 11 February 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue and White to support the 2025 Oceania Track Championships. 

The Oceania Cycling Championships is a collection of cycling competitions across several cycling disciplines held annually to determine the Oceania champion in each respective discipline. The Championships bring together the top track cyclists from Australia and New Zealand in a competition for individual and national honours. 

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency 

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.description:
Tuesday, 11 February 2025

The Story Bridge will be lit Dark Blue, Light Blue and White to support the 2025 Oceania Track Championships. 

The Oceania Cycling Championships is a collection of cycling competitions across several cycling disciplines held annually to determine the Oceania champion in each respective discipline. The Championships bring together the top track cyclists from Australia and New Zealand in a competition for individual and national honours. 

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency 

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Queensland Firebirds First Season Game
item.description:
Wednesday, 12 February 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Queensland Firebirds First Season Game

The first match of the Firebirds 2025 is near and Netball Queensland would like to use this opportunity to inspire women and girls, encourage physical activity and family connection, as Brisbane to gets behind the Firebirds chase for the Super Netball Title.

This Light Up is organsied by: Netball Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Evvent in City Hall

This Light Up is organised by: Leishman Associates Pty Ltd

item.title: SweetHeart Day
item.description:
Friday, 14 February 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red and Blue to support SweetHeart Day

The annual SweetHeart Day campaign coincides with Valentines Day, raising awareness and funds to help HeartKids achieve it's objective to support, educate and advocate for those affected by CoHD throughout their lives. With 250,000 Australians impacted by childhood onset heart disease (CoHD), including nearly 6,400 with rheumatic heart disease (RHD) in regional and remote areas, HeartKids plays a critical role in providing lifelong support, resources, and advocacy.

This Light Up is organsied by: Heartkids Ltd

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Story Bridge will be lit Red and Blue to support SweetHeart Day

item.title: International Angelman Day
item.description:
Saturday, 15 February 2025

The Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support the International Angelman Day.

Angelman Syndrome Association Australia (ASAA) is the key advocacy and peer support organisation for people living with Angelman syndrome and their families in Australia. We exist to support, inform, educate, network, promote research, and to advocate for families affected by Angelman syndrome. International Angelman Day occurs on 15 February and is the key national and global event to raise awareness of the rare disease Angelman syndrome.

This Light Up is organised by: Angelman Syndrome Association Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
item.xCal:description:
The Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support the International Angelman Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Angelman Syndrome Association Australia

item.title: Small Steps For Hannah
item.description:
Wednesday, 19 February 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink to support Small Steps For Hannah

The aim of the event is to raise awareness of Domestic and Family Violence through remembering victims Hannah Clarke and her 3 children Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey who lost their lives on February 19, 2020. The campaign of 19 days of Handstands is to remember their beautiful and fun lives through handstanding over 19 days (Feb 1 - Feb 19) to bring the community together and celebrate them through something they loved doing together. This will be the 4th year of our Handstand campaign.

This Light Up is organsied by: Small Steps 4 Hannah Foundation

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Cholangiocarcinomia Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, 20 February 2025

City Hall will be lit Green to support World Cholangiocarcinomia Cancer Awareness Month

The Light Australia Green Initiative is an effort to unite people nationwide around a common goal: A comprehensive annual campaign of green-themed events, symposiums, and innovative initiatives dedicated to raising awareness and driving engagement in bile health and bile-related cancer response strategies. This initiative acts as an overarching umbrella that unites patients, caregivers, families, medical and allied professionals, healthcare providers, researchers, and the science community.

This Light Up is organsied by: Cholangiocarcinoma Foundation Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Navy Week - Beat to Quarters
item.description:
Friday, 21 February 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate Navy Week - Beat to Quarters

Showcasing Navy’s importance to the Australian way of life. The Navy will celebrate its traditions and heritage through a number of events across Brisbane for Navy Week and we encourage all to come along. Join us for Beat to Quarters at King George Square. Beat to Quarters is a tradition dating back to the age of sails. It was the sound of a ships drum that would summon the Sailors to action stations when battle was imminent. Today we keep the beat to quarters tradition going to honour the courage and sacrifice of men and women that have served in the Royal Australian Navy.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: World Encephalitis Day
item.description:
Saturday, 22 February 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support World Encephalitis Day

On World Encephalitis Day, landmarks around the word will be lighting up in red to shine a light on encephalitis and raise awareness of the devastating and often life-threatening condition, which can leave survivors with lifelong difficulties. Around 500,000 people globally are affected by encephalitis annually, equating to one person every minute, however, almost 80 per cent of people do not know what encephalitis is. Lack of awareness leads to delays in diagnosis and treatment, and poorer patient outcomes. Australian members of global charity Encephalitis International, are hoping to inform other Australians of the seriousness of encephalitis and to elevate encephalitis as a global health priority.

This Light Up is organsied by: Encephalitis International

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: 20th Anniversary of Critical Care Research Group
item.description:
Tuesday, 25 February 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Maroon to support 20th Anniversary of Critical Care Research Group

The Critical Care Research Group celebrates 20 years of game-changing patient-focused research. Our 20-year anniversary celebrations will raise awareness and funds to help our emerging researchers discover tomorrow’s best treatments

This Light Up is organsied by: The Prince Charles Hospital Foundation

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Rare Disease Day
item.description:
Friday, 28 February 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple, Blue, Pink and Green to support Rare Disease Day

Rare Disease Day is marked on the last day of February annually. It is the globally coordinated movement for rare diseases, working to raise awareness and generate change for the 300 million people worldwide and the estimated two million Australians that are living with a rare disease, as well as their families and carers. The Day aims to provide awareness for the need of equity in social opportunity, healthcare, and access to diagnosis and therapies.
Rare Voices Australia (RVA) is the national peak body for Australians living with a rare disease. RVA provides a strong, unified voice to advocate for policy as well as health, disability and other systems that work for people living with a rare disease. Our person-centred focus sees us working with all key stakeholders, including people living with a rare disease, governments, key peak bodies, researchers, clinicians, and industry. We advocate for the best outcomes for Australians living with a rare disease.

This Light Up is organsied by: Rare Voices Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Navy Week
item.description:
Saturday, 1 March 2025

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, white and Blue to celebrate Navy Week.

Over seven days, events will be held to showcase Navy's importance to the Australian way of life. The Navy will continue to celebrate its tradition and heritage and we encourage all members of the broader community to come along to the Navy week celebrations. Navy Week is an excellent opportunity for our people who serve, their families and the broader Australian community to come together and recognise the critical role our Navy plays in safeguarding the prosperity of our nation, on and under the sea.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Australian Navy

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
